newsitem.title: GREECE: Greece's Xiosbank on course for 97 profit target.
newsitem.headline: Greece's Xiosbank on course for 97 profit target.

text.p: Xiosbank pretax profits grew in the first five months of the year at a rate consistent with its 1997 profit target of 2.7 billion drachmas ($9.9 million), its general manager Yannis Pehlivanidis told shareholders.
Xiosbank, only recently listed on the main market, posted pretax earnings of 2.106 billion drachmas in 1996.

Total outstanding loans grew 37.38 percent year-on-year to 120.8 billion drachmas at the end of May and its deposit balances rose 32.13 percent year-on-year to 143.77 billion, Pehlivanidis told the bank's annual shareholders meeting.
Loans stood at 102.5 billion drachmas at the end of 1996 compared to 81.28 billion at the end of 1995 and deposits rose to 183.4 billion drachmas from 166.2 billion at the end of 1995.
Assets under management by the bank's mutual funds jumped 116.2 percent to 124.7 billion drachmas in May from 57.68 billion the same month of 1996.
Xiosbank's has 26 branches and has reached agreements to lease new branches in Pagrati, Athens and the cities of Hania and Ioannina, he added.
